intro: Suregada pulgarensis, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
